00165     class Node
00166     {
00167       public:
00168         // Node Constructor
00169         Node() { next = NULL; }
00170 
00171         Etype element; 
00172         Node* next;  
00173     }; 
00174 
00175     Node *head,        // points to first node of list 
00176     *current;     // points to node at current list position
00177 
00178     int size;          // number of nodes in list
00179

00182 // List
00183 //  - default constructor
00184 template <class Etype>
00185 List<Etype>::List()
00186 {
00187   head = current = NULL; 
00188   size=0; 
00189 }
00190 
00191 
00192 //***************************************************************
00193 // CONSTRUCTOR
00194 //   Creates an ordered list of consecutive elements from the 
00195 //   element "low" to the element "high".
00196 //***************************************************************
00197 template <class Etype>
00198 List<Etype>::List(Etype aLow, Etype aHigh)
00199 {
00200   head = current = NULL; 
00201   size=0; 
00202 
00203   for(Etype x = aLow; x <= aHigh; x++)
00204     InsertAfter(x);
00205 }
00206 
00207 
00208 // List
00209 //  - copy constructor
00210 //  - parameters : origList - a previously allocated List object
00211 //  - initializes the list to be a copy of origList
00212 template <class Etype>
00213 List<Etype>::List(const List<Etype>& origList)
00214 {
00215   Node *origListPtr = origList.head,
00216   *newListPtr; 
00217 
00218   if (origListPtr == NULL)  // then origList is empty
00219   {
00220     current = head = NULL; 
00221     size=0; 
00222   }
00223   else   // origList is not empty; copy it node for node
00224   {
00225     // at least one node in origList; create that node
00226     newListPtr = new Node; 
00227     newListPtr->element = origListPtr->element; 
00228     if (origListPtr == origList.current)  // place current pointer at 
00229       current = newListPtr;            // same spot in new list
00230     head = newListPtr; 
00231     origListPtr = origListPtr->next; 
00232 
00233     while (origListPtr !=NULL) // keep creating nodes as long as there
00234     {                         //  are nodes in origList
00235       newListPtr->next = new Node; 
00236       newListPtr = newListPtr->next; 
00237       if (origListPtr == origList.current)
00238         current = newListPtr; 
00239       newListPtr->element = origListPtr->element; 
00240       origListPtr = origListPtr->next; 
00241     }
00242     newListPtr->next = NULL;   // last node points to NULL 
00243     size = origList.size;       
00244   }
00245 }

00250 // ~List
00251 //  - destructor
00252 //  - deallocates all dynamically allocated memory inside the list
00253 template <class Etype>
00254 List<Etype>::~List()
00255 {
00256   Clear(); 
00257 }

00261 // Clear
00262 //  - deletes all values from list, resulting in an empty list
00263 template <class Etype>
00264 void List<Etype>::Clear()
00265 {
00266 
00267   Node *deletionPtr = head; 
00268   current = head; 
00269 
00270   while (current != NULL)
00271   {
00272     current = current->next; 
00273     delete deletionPtr; 
00274     deletionPtr = current; 
00275   }
00276 
00277   head = current = NULL; 
00278   size=0; 
00279 }

00283 
00284 // operator=
00285 //  - parameters: origList - a previously allocated List object
00286 //  - sets the the list to be a copy of origList
00287 template <class Etype>
00288 List<Etype>& List<Etype>::operator=(const List<Etype>& origList)
00289 {
00290 
00291   if (this!=&origList)
00292   {
00293     Clear(); 
00294 
00295     Node *origListPtr = origList.head,
00296     *newListPtr;
00297 
00298     if (origListPtr == NULL)  // then origList is empty
00299     {
00300       current = head = NULL;
00301       size=0;
00302     }
00303     else
00304     {
00305       newListPtr = new Node;
00306       newListPtr->element = origListPtr->element;
00307       if (origListPtr == origList.current)
00308         current = newListPtr;
00309       head = newListPtr;
00310       origListPtr = origListPtr->next;
00311 
00312       while (origListPtr !=NULL)
00313       {
00314         newListPtr->next = new Node; 
00315         newListPtr = newListPtr->next; 
00316         if (origListPtr == origList.current)
00317           current = newListPtr; 
00318         newListPtr->element = origListPtr->element; 
00319         origListPtr = origListPtr->next; 
00320       }
00321       newListPtr->next = NULL; 
00322       size = origList.size; 
00323     }
00324   }  // end if
00325 
00326   return *this;
00327 
00328 }

00333 // InsertAfter
00334 //  - parameters : newElem - an element of the list's type, to be inserted
00335 //  - inserts newElem after current position in list
00336 template <class Etype>
00337 void List<Etype>::InsertAfter(Etype newElem)
00338 {
00339   Node *tempPtr = new Node; 
00340   tempPtr->element = newElem; 
00341 
00342   if (size==0)
00343   {
00344     tempPtr->next=NULL; 
00345     current = head = tempPtr; 
00346   }
00347   else
00348   {
00349     tempPtr->next = current->next; 
00350     current->next = tempPtr; 
00351     current = tempPtr;
00352   }
00353   size++; 
00354 }
00355 
00356 
00357 
00358 // InsertBefore
00359 //  - parameters : newElem - an element of the list's type, to be inserted
00360 //  - inserts newElem before current position in list
00361 template <class Etype>
00362 void List<Etype>::InsertBefore(Etype newElem)
00363 {
00364   Node *tempPtr = new Node;
00365 
00366   if (size==0)
00367   {
00368     tempPtr->element = newElem;
00369     tempPtr->next = NULL;
00370     current = head = tempPtr;
00371   }
00372   else
00373   {
00374     tempPtr->element = current->element;
00375     tempPtr->next = current->next;
00376     current->element = newElem;
00377     current->next = tempPtr;
00378   }
00379   size++;
00380 }
00381 
00382 
00383 //***************************************************************
00384 // PUBLIC:  InsertInOrder
00385 //   Inserts element in the order it's supposed to come in in the
00386 //   list (i.e., builds a smallest to largest list).
00387 //***************************************************************
00388 template <class Etype>
00389 void List<Etype>::InsertInOrder(Etype newElem)
00390 {
00391   current = head;
00392 
00393   if(size == 0)
00394   {
00395     InsertAfter(newElem);
00396     return;
00397   }
00398 
00399   while(newElem > current->element)
00400   {
00401     if(current->next == NULL)
00402       break;
00403     else
00404       current = current->next;
00405   }
00406 
00407   if(newElem < current->element)
00408     InsertBefore(newElem);
00409   else
00410     InsertAfter(newElem);
00411 }
00412 
00413 
00414 // Remove
00415 //  - removes the element at the current postition of the list
00416 template <class Etype> 
00417 void List<Etype>::Remove()
00418 {
00419   Node *removePtr; 
00420 
00421   if (size==0)
00422   {
00423     if(size <= 0)
00424 //    cerr << "Attempt to remove an element from an empty list." << endl; 
00425       cout << "Attempt to remove an element from an empty list." << endl; 
00426     return; 
00427   }   
00428   else if (size==1)
00429   {
00430     delete current; 
00431     head = current = NULL;
00432   }
00433   else if (current->next == NULL)   // deleting last element
00434   {
00435     removePtr = head; 
00436     while (removePtr->next != current)
00437       removePtr = removePtr->next; 
00438     removePtr->next = NULL; 
00439     delete current; 
00440     current = removePtr; 
00441   }
00442   else   // this is the case you would expect to reach most often
00443   {
00444     removePtr = current->next; 
00445     current->element = removePtr->element; 
00446     current->next = removePtr->next; 
00447     delete removePtr; 
00448   }
00449   size--; 
00450 }

00455 // Update
00456 //  - parameters : updateElem - an element of the list's type
00457 //  - replaces the value at the current position with updateElem
00458 template <class Etype>
00459 void List<Etype>::Update(Etype updateElem)
00460 {  
00461   if(size <= 0)
00462 //  cerr << "Cannot update an element in an empty list." << endl; 
00463     cout << "Cannot update an element in an empty list." << endl; 
00464   if (size > 0)
00465     current->element = updateElem; 
00466 }

00473 //  - makes the first position in the list the current position
00474 template <class Etype>
00475 void List<Etype>::Head()
00476 {
00477   current = head;

00482 
00483 // Tail
00484 //  - makes the last position in the list the current position
00485 template <class Etype>
00486 void List<Etype>::Tail()
00487 {
00488   if (size > 0)
00489     while (current->next!=NULL)
00490       current = current->next;  
00491 }
00492

00496 
00497 // operator++
00498 //  - moves the current position one forward in the list
00499 template <class Etype>
00500 List<Etype>& List<Etype>::operator++(int)
00501 {
00502   if (size > 0)   // if there are nodes in the list
00503     if (current->next != NULL)  // and we are not on the last one
00504       current =  current->next;   // increment the current pointer 
00505   return *this; 
00506 }
00507 
00508 
00509 
00510 
00511 
00512 // operator--
00513 //  - moves the current position one backward in the list
00514 template <class Etype>
00515 List<Etype>& List<Etype>::operator--(int)
00516 {
00517   if (current!=head)
00518   {
00519     Node *beforePtr = head; 
00520     while (beforePtr->next != current)
00521       beforePtr = beforePtr->next; 
00522     current = beforePtr; 
00523   }
00524   return *this; 
00525 }

00530 // Retrieve
00531 //  - returns the element at the current list position
00532 template <class Etype>
00533 Etype List<Etype>::Retrieve() const
00534 {
00535   return current->element;    
00536 }

00540 
00541 // Includes
00542 //  - parameters : queryElem - an element of the list's type, to be searched for
00543 //  - return value : a boolean yes or no
00544 //  - searches list for queryElem...if found, make that position the current
00545 //    position and return 1; otherwise, return 0
00546 template <class Etype>
00547 int List<Etype>::Includes(Etype queryElem)
00548 {
00549   Node *searchPtr = head;
00550   while ((searchPtr !=NULL) && (searchPtr->element != queryElem))
00551     searchPtr = searchPtr->next; 
00552   if (searchPtr == NULL)
00553     return 0; 
00554   else
00555   {
00556     current = searchPtr; 
00557     return 1; 
00558   }
00559 }

00566 //  - returns the length of the list
00567 template <class Etype>
00568 int List<Etype>::Length() const
00569 {

00574 //***************************************************************
00575 // PUBLIC:  Print   
00576 //   A quick and easy way to print out a list used mainly for
00577 //   testing purposes.
00578 //***************************************************************
00579 template <class Etype>
00580 void List<Etype>::Print()
00581 {
00582   Node* temp = current;
00583   Head();
00584   for(int x = 0; x < size; x++)
00585   {
00586     if(x != 0)
00587       cout << ", ";
00588 
00589     cout << current->element;
00590 
00591     (*this)++;
00592   }
00593   current = temp;
00594   cout << endl;
00595 }

00598 //***************************************************************
00599 // PUBLIC:  Sieve   
00600 //  Takes a sieve and keeps only the elements that are common 
00601 //  to both this list and the sieve.
00602 //***************************************************************
00603 template <class Etype>
00604 void List<Etype>::Sieve(List<Etype> &aSieve)
00605 {
00606   if((size == 0) || (aSieve.size == 0))
00607   {
00608     return;
00609   }
00610 
00611   current = head;
00612   int items = size;
00613 
00614   for(int x = 0; x < items; x++)
00615   {
00616     if(aSieve.Includes(current->element))
00617       (*this)++;
00618     else
00619       Remove();
00620   }
00621 }

00624 //***************************************************************
00625 // PUBLIC:  PickFromList
00626 //   Removes all elements outside of the range of [low, high].   
00627 //***************************************************************
00628 template <class Etype>
00629 void List<Etype>::PickFromList(Etype aLow, Etype aHigh)
00630 {
00631   if(size == 0)
00632   {
00633 //  cerr << "Cannot pick from an empty list." << endl; 
00634     cout << "Cannot pick from an empty list." << endl; 
00635     return;
00636   }
00637 
00638 
00639   Head();
00640 
00641   int listLen = Length();
00642   int item;
00643   for(int x = 0; x < listLen; x++)
00644   {
00645     item = Retrieve();
00646     if((item < aLow) || (item > aHigh))
00647       Remove();
00648     else
00649       (*this)++;
00650   } 
00651 }

00654 //***************************************************************
00655 // PUBLIC:  Sum
00656 //   Sums all the elements in the list and returns the result.   
00657 //***************************************************************
00658 template <class Etype>
00659 Etype List<Etype>::Sum()
00660 {
00661   if(size == 0)
00662   {
00663 //  cerr << "Cannot sum an empty list." << endl; 
00664     cout << "Cannot sum an empty list." << endl; 
00665     return (Etype)0;
00666   }
00667 
00668 
00669   Node* temp = current;
00670   Head();
00671 
00672   Etype sum = Retrieve();
00673   (*this)++;
00674 
00675   for(int x = 1; x < size; x++)
00676   {
00677     sum += Retrieve();
00678     (*this)++;
00679   }
00680 
00681   current = temp;
00682 
00683   return sum;
00684 }

00689 //***************************************************************
00690 // PUBLIC:  Min
00691 //   Returns the smallest element in the list.   
00692 //***************************************************************
00693 template <class Etype>
00694 Etype List<Etype>::Min()
00695 {
00696   if(size == 0)
00697   {
00698 //  cerr << "Cannot min an empty list." << endl; 
00699     cout << "Cannot min an empty list." << endl; 
00700     return (Etype)0;
00701   }
00702 
00703   Node* temp = current;
00704   Head();
00705 
00706   Etype item = current->element;
00707   (*this)++;
00708 
00709   for(int x = 1; x < size; x++)
00710   {
00711     if(current->element < item)
00712       item = current->element;
00713     (*this)++;
00714   }
00715 
00716   current = temp;
00717 
00718   return item;
00719 }

00729 Etype List<Etype>::Max()

00732   {
00733 //  cerr << "Cannot max an empty list." << endl; 
00734     cout << "Cannot max an empty list." << endl; 
00735     return (Etype)0;
00736   }
00737 
00738   Node* temp = current;
00739   Head();
00740 
00741   Etype item = current->element;
00742   (*this)++;
00743 
00744   for(int x = 1; x < size; x++)
00745   {
00746     if(current->element > item)
00747       item = current->element;
00748     (*this)++;
00749   }
00750 
00751   current = temp;
00752 
00753   return item;
00754 }

00757 //***************************************************************
00758 // PUBLIC:  Transpose
00759 //   Transposes the list so that the smallest element starts at
00760 //     "aStart" and every other element is adjusted accordingly
00761 //     in a linear fashion.   
00762 //***************************************************************
00763 template <class Etype>
00764 void List<Etype>::Transpose(Etype aStart)
00765 {
00766   if(size == 0)
00767   {
00768 //  cerr << "Cannot transpose an empty list." << endl; 
00769     cout << "Cannot transpose an empty list." << endl; 
00770     return;
00771   }
00772 
00773   Node* temp = current;
00774   Head();
00775 
00776   Etype correction = Min() - aStart;
00777   for(int x = 0; x < size; x++)
00778   {
00779     current->element -= correction;
00780     (*this)++;
00781   }
00782 
00783   current = temp;
00784 }
00785 
00786 
00787 //***************************************************************
00788 // PUBLIC:  Normalize
00789 //   Normalizes the list.  
00790 //***************************************************************
00791 template <class Etype>
00792 void List<Etype>::Normalize()
00793 {
00794   if(size == 0)
00795   {
00796 //  cerr << "Cannot normalize an empty list." << endl; 
00797     cout << "Cannot normalize an empty list." << endl; 
00798     return;
00799   }
00800 
00801   Node* temp = current;
00802   Head();
00803 
00804   Etype sum = Sum();
00805 
00806   for(int x = 0; x < size; x++)
00807   {
00808     current->element /= sum;
00809     (*this)++;
00810   }
00811 
00812   current = temp;
00813 }

00815 
00816 //***************************************************************
00817 // PUBLIC:  Scale
00818 //   Scale successively adds the previous element to the current
00819 // element.  For example, if the list was (0.1, 0.5, 0.15, 0.25)
00820 // scale would transform this list into (0.1, 0.6, 0.75, 1.0).  
00821 //***************************************************************
00822 template <class Etype>
00823 void List<Etype>::Scale()
00824 {
00825   if(size == 0)
00826   {
00827 //  cerr << "Cannot normalize an empty list." << endl; 
00828     cout << "Cannot normalize an empty list." << endl; 
00829     return;
00830   }
00831   else if(size == 1)
00832   {
00833     return;
00834   }
00835 
00836 
00837   Node* temp = current;
00838 
00839   Head();
00840   Etype previous = current->element;
00841   (*this)++;
00842 
00843   for(int x = 1; x < size; x++)
00844   {
00845     current->element += previous;
00846     previous = current->element;
00847     (*this)++;
00848   }
00849 
00850   current = temp;
00851 }
00852 
00853 
00854 //***************************************************************
00855 // PUBLIC:  InsertionSort
00856 //   Sorts the list.  
00857 //***************************************************************
00858 template <class Etype>
00859 void List<Etype>::InsertionSort()
00860 {
00861 
00862   List<Etype>* sortedList = new List<Etype>();
00863 
00864   current = head;
00865   for(int x = 0; x < size; x++)
00866   { 
00867     sortedList->InsertInOrder(current->element);
00868     current = current->next;
00869   }
00870 
00871   Clear();
00872   (*this) = *sortedList;
00873   delete sortedList;
00874 }
00875 
00876 
00877 
00878 #endif
